global_instructions.source_of_truth: Use only facts from the uploaded PDF. If information is missing, write: 'Information not available at time of assessment.' Do not guess.
global_instructions.style: Objective, concise, payer-compliant. Use full sentences. Avoid jargon and speculation.
global_instructions.compliance_focus: Include frequency, intensity, duration, and functional impairment (FID/Impairment) when relevant. Explain why a lower level of care is insufficient when risk is present.
global_instructions.dates_times: Use ISO dates when exact dates are present in the PDF; otherwise, keep narrative without inventing dates.
global_instructions.null_policy: If a fact is absent, set structured fields to null and use the fallback sentence for narratives.

sections.title: Onset/Duration of Presenting Problems
sections.instruction: Describe key symptoms and include frequency, intensity, and duration (FID) when available.

sections.title: Resources and Strengths
sections.instruction: Document the client's resources, strengths, and protective factors exactly as stated.

sections.title: Barriers to Treatment
sections.instruction: Describe the client's barriers to initiating or maintaining treatment (transportation, cost, technology, childcare, motivation, etc.).

sections.title: Developmental Status
sections.instruction: Briefly describe developmental upbringing and relevant milestones if documented.

sections.title: Trauma History
sections.instruction: State the client's trauma history (event(s), frequency, duration, age at occurrence if available).

sections.title: Financial Resources and Benefits
sections.instruction: Report the client's income source(s), benefits, or financial constraints that impact care.

sections.title: Ability to Access Services
sections.instruction: Describe transportation, technology, language, or scheduling factors that affect access.

sections.title: Current/Previous Living Situation and Family History
sections.instruction: Outline current/previous living situation (household members, stability, safety) and relevant family mental health history.

sections.title: Primary Support Group
sections.instruction: List key supports.

sections.title: Legal Profile
sections.instruction: Provide yes/no and details when available.

sections.title: Drug and Alcohol Profile
sections.instruction: Outline the client's and immediate family's substance use when documented.

sections.title: Risk Assessment
sections.instruction: Document SI/HI exactly as stated. Use status fields for presence and provide narratives only if present.

sections.title: Communication Needs
sections.instruction: If the client has communication needs, summarize them and any accommodations.

sections.title: Mobility and Adaptive Equipment Needs
sections.instruction: Summarize mobility limitations and adaptive equipment needs if documented.

sections.title: Clinically Significant Findings
sections.instruction: Provide a concise, payer-compliant synthesis of the assessment noting FID, functional impairment, and risk if present.

sections.title: Resources, Strengths, and Interests
sections.instruction: Summarize client strengths and interests that support treatment engagement and recovery.

sections.title: Safety Plan
sections.instruction: Complete only if any risk status is not 'none'. Use facts only.
